result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
11:04 AM Defendant Corell E Evans in court, in custody.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Corell E Evans.  Attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Nickolie makes a statement to the court as to the competency order in this matter. 
Atty Gutierrez makes a statement. 
Court finds defendant is not competency not likely to regain competency.
Court will suspend proceeding and not order any further court appearances.
Court will order transfer of the sheriff department to mental health center. 
Atty Martin makes a statement to the court
dated 09-06-2022, filed by the State updating the Court that they will no longer be contesting the doctor's report and will be stipulating.

1:38 pm  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Corell E Evans. Corell Evans appeared in person, in custody. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court placed matter on for a status hearing and addressed the new doctors report in this matter. 
All parties have received the doctors report. 
Parties request matter remain for a competency hearing. 
All parties will be ready for competency hearing on 9/6/22 at 11:00 am
Status hearing on August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
dated 08-12-2022 as addendum to the report submitted on 07-19-2022;  filed by Dr. Gust-Brey
Competency hearing on September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

03:36 PM Defendant Corell E Evans in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin by zoom.
Only one doctor can appear today by zoom. 
State requests a new date as they would need both doctors to appear for the hearing. 
Defense does not object. 
Court sets a new hearing date. 
Court is able to get ahold of Dr Gust Brey and confirm the date with her. 
Court leaves message for Dr Murtagh and will call back to confirm date.
Doctors are allowed to appear by zoom for the next hearing.
Defendant to remain in Waukesha County Jail until the next hearing date. 
  Competency hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Competency hearing on August 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

09:24 AM Defendant Corell E Evans in court by zoom from Mendota Mental Health Center with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court does have the doctors report along with a request for a medications order. 
Atty Gutierrez requests a competency hearing.
Court sets up hearing with Dr Gust Brey to appear by zoom and leaves a message with Dr Murtagh to appear by zoom.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
proposed medications order
dated 7/19/22 from Kevin Murtaugh MD
cover sheet for confidential records
dated 7/19/22 prepared by Dr Gust Brey
Hearing on July 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:41 AM Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court.   Defendant Corell E Evans did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jail staff states defendant is not agreeing to come to court today and will not leave his cell. 
Atty Gutierrez makes a statement to the court and does object to inpatient evaluation.  
State has no comment at this time. 
Court is concerned this matter is taking time and will continue to monitor. 
Court will set matter out two weeks to see if defendant has been moved to be evaluated.  Hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
for In-Patient Examination signed by Judge Paul Bugenhagen Jr. on 06/24/2022.
Review hearing on July 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:01 AM Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court.   Defendant Corell E Evans refused to appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests inpatient examination and a review hearing within 2 weeks.  State has no objection.  Court orders examination.  Defense counsel advises to use of force only to enforce evaluation.  Review hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Review hearing on June 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.

02:16 PM Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court.   Defendant Corell E Evans did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is in custody and refuses to appear for court.  Defense counsel provided an update to the Court regarding competency.  State asks Court to order inpatient evaluation.  Court resets matter for tomorrow at 10:45 am.  Defense counsel requests that court compel defendant to appear tomorrow.  Review hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Review hearing on June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Review hearing on June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:54 PM Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for Defendant Corell E Evans. Attorney  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant Corell E Evans not in court. Defendant is in custody at the Waukesha County Jail and is refusing to come to Court. 

Atty Gutierrez requests more time to speak with the Defendant one more time.  Review hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm. **CORRECTED, set for June 23, 2022 at 1:30 p.m.**

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Brookfield Square Mall/Witness A/Witness B/Witness C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

03:40 PM Defendant Corell E Evans in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden appears as friend of the court.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  COURT ORDERS FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  The Court will set this matter before the Trial Court for review on competency.  Review hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
